titleStmt.title: A booke which sheweth the life and manners of all true Christians and howe vnlike they are vnto Turkes and Papistes, and heathen folke. Also the pointes and partes of all diuinitie, that is of the reuealed will and worde of God are declared by their seuerall definitions and diuisions in order as followeth. Also there goeth a treatise before of reformation without tarying for anie, and of the wickednesse of those preachers, which will not refourme them selues and their charge, because they will tarie till the magistrate commanude and compell them. By me, Robert Brovvne.
titleStmt.author: Browne, Robert, ca. 1550-1633.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A69006 of text S109446 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 3910.3). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 256 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 54 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

Images scanned from microfilm: (Early English books, 1475-1640 ; 180:11, 214:07 or 2039:6)

titleStmt.title: A booke which sheweth the life and manners of all true Christians and howe vnlike they are vnto Turkes and Papistes, and heathen folke. Also the pointes and partes of all diuinitie, that is of the reuealed will and worde of God are declared by their seuerall definitions and diuisions in order as followeth. Also there goeth a treatise before of reformation without tarying for anie, and of the wickednesse of those preachers, which will not refourme them selues and their charge, because they will tarie till the magistrate commanude and compell them. By me, Robert Brovvne.
titleStmt.author: Browne, Robert, ca. 1550-1633.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Richarde Painter [i.e. Richard Schilders],

notesStmt.note: "A booke which sheweth the life and manners of all true Christians" has separately dated title page and register.
A different state of the edition collating A-B⁴ C² D-H⁴; A-O⁴. Quire D contains a different version of the preface to part 2, ending on D2v.
Identified as STC 3910 on reel 180, and STC 3910+ on reel 214.
Reproductions of the originals in the Yale University. Library (reels 180, 214) and the Bodleian Library (reel 2039).
